titles.title: Assessing NASA Science Mission Extensions Act
Assessing NASA Science Mission Extensions Act
To require the Administrator of NASA to assess the cost and schedule implications of extending science missions beyond planned mission lifetimes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Science, Space, and Technology.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Space.

bill.summary: Assessing NASA Science Mission Extensions Act - Instructs the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), in conducting assessments of the costs and benefits of extending the date of the termination of data collection for those science missions that have exceeded their planned mission lifetime, to consider: (1) the potential continued benefit of instruments on such missions; and (2) the cost and schedule impacts, if any, of mission extension on other NASA activities and science missions.
